page.title: 04The Major Whitbread Charity
page.content: Thomas Whitbread, of the family who were the Lords of the manor and who owned Fambridge Hall and White Notley Hall left some land when he died in 1686. The actual field and the cottage are just outside our area but was to provide money for 'the ancientest poor of the parish of White Notley. Originally the money was used to provide bread for any poor people who came to church on Sunday and listened to the sermon. The bread was left in the church porch. The Trust now has more money to give away each year. It is not used to provide bread any more but to provide a gift of money to widows and widowers following the death of their spouse. In 1983 all pensioners in the village were given a Â£5 food voucher to spend in the village shop.
